title: Are NCERT books helpful for UPSC preparation? How should one use them? - Quora
tags: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)

response.answer_text: To read or avoid NCERT is not the question -But, how much chance can one afford to take in this highly uncertain UPSC exam should be the real question,if any at all. Going by the school’s logic!!!In our schools before we were able to write complete meaningful sentences our teachers taught us to read and write the very basic English words first and then we proceed towards making or forming small sentences with the use of proper Grammar !!!!And that was done for a reason as learning is a step by step process and each step has its own importance and can not be undermined or better skipped.Indeed the NCERT books are helpful and somewhat important!!!Now that being said,so NCERT’s are those very fundamental books which helps one to make his basics clear and make the path some what smoother for what may come ahead.NCERT books are in very lucid English and reading them will make your base or foundation more strong and resistible to further chaos and confusion that can arise at a later stage,just to say but who knows, better be safe and be prepared.NCERT books are easily available and relatively cheaper compared to any other books, both content and size wise.They can also be easily downloaded from the internet for free.How to use them?Like any other study material and NCERT being the fundamental one should be given a through reading which will help in making all the basic detail and concepts more affluent to you.some aspirants go for through reading of NCERT’s from class 6–12 and some go for class 9–12 based on their self evaluation and choice.Like for ancient history old Tamil Nadu state board books of class 11th and 12th are suggested.Similarly polity,history,economics and few chapters from science NCERTS are suggested.So,finally NCERT books will help in laying foundation-basic concepts and after that you will be ready to get hold of other pieces of Gyan.Link to my other answer -Roshani Gupta's answer to What should be my strategy if I am trying for next year’s UPSC CSE, given that I scored less on this year's prelims (~90)?

Absolutely yes…. Reading NCERT books is one of the most important part of the preparation. Even if you are a scholar of a particular subject,still you should read NCERT book at least for once because if you go through the previous years questions you will find atleast 10 questions that comes directly from NCERTs. Moreover the books are written in simple language that everyone can easily understand. It also helps us to build a basic understanding on various topics which will be beneficial for solving questions. Q. How to read NCERT books? Answer: First of all let me clear the difference between the most confusing topic i.e old and new NCERT. Both are same but the old NCERT are more analytical and new NCERT are more factual in nature. Lets take the example of history. We all know history is broadly divided into four parts.Ancient, Medieval,Modern and world. NCERT covers all the topics nicely.For ancient history find out the NCERT book which covers ancient history only.Like old NCERT by RS Sarmah . You might find some NCErt books of junior level class like class 5 or 6. No need to read or follow junior class NCERT.They are very basic.Just chose the higher class.After that read chapter wise.If unable to understand then watch some videos on YouTube to clear your doubts.After that make short notes on every chapter. This will help you in revision. Hope it helps….

NCERT books …are a must… atleast the 11th and 12th are a must do… In fact , I felt the coaching centres , sometimes , makes simple things difficult…NCERTs are simple and provide the static material needed for the exam… apart from that Laxmikant​ for Polity is a must, Spectrum for Modern India. For economy , ICSE board Saraswati publication 11th and 12 th std book is very useful ( it was better than ncert). NCERT books are to be used for covering your static basic material… supplement it with the current affairs and daily newspaper reading… Join a test series and they will provide what ncert to read and current affairs accordingly.

YES. These books are useful. Consider reading books from 8 the grade to 12th. Cover the basic history part . This means Indian history pre and post colonization. Post independence history. World war 1& 2. Other history chapters.
